title: Does cell phone which we use both for call and internet so which waves it's use microwave or radio waves? - Quora

response.answer_text: Its all the same. Radio waves are part of the electromagnetic spectrum – ranging between frequencies of 3 Hz and 300 GHz corresponding to wavelengths of 100,000 kilometers and 1 mm. Microwaves are essentially radio waves and have wavelengths that range 1 mm to 1 meter. Different wavelengths or bands of microwaves are used for different applications. Mid-wavelength microwaves are used for satellite communication. Long wavelength microwaves are used in microwave ovens and so on. Cell phones use 900, 1800, and 1900 MHz bands. As for the Internet, quite recently the 25 to 39 GHz band was allotted to the 5G spectrum, and in future, 95 GHz to 3 THz range — a collection of frequencies that aren’t currently being used in any consumer devices, but have wide bandwidth with vast potential for data streaming may be employed.
